stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream integrating and play-testing a new "Egg-Coin Radar" for the 7th star of each course, fixes a light-spawn bug in Course 1, and talks through demo-release plans and overall course status.

development_findings.summary: Each course now has seven stars; the 7th act is always "Find the Egg Coins," triggering a proximity-based radar similar to Sonic Adventure 1.
development_findings.quote: Instead of six stars, there's now seven stars in the act select and the last act is always called Find the Egg Coins.

development_findings.summary: Radar flashes faster and shifts from green to red as Mario approaches a coin; earlier acts only show coin icons as gray (unfound) or gold (found).
The radar was moved from a purchasable item to an automatic feature to avoid a potentially "miserable", hint-less experience.
development_findings.quote: Imagine you have not bought the radar and you're doing a mission 7 and the game doesn't give you any hint at all. That's gonna suck.

development_findings.summary: Kaze experiments with making the radar less distracting—testing slower blinking, transparency, and color options to avoid overlap with level-specific coin colors.
Coins will fund overworld upgrades (e.g., donate 500 coins so an NPC can build a bridge), aiming to make coins feel "more valuable than Mario Odyssey."
development_findings.quote: You're actually gonna affect the world by giving people money—that's gonna be so cool.

development_findings.summary: Dynamic lights in a section of Course 1 failed to spawn because bhvParam3 was set to 255, which prevents object creation in the SM64 engine.
development_findings.quote: There's a functionality where if you set the bhv param 3 to 255 the object does not spawn. This is so wild.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are planned; Course 13 (Ice Castle) is nearly done, Course 14 (Craft World) mostly done, Course 15 (Space Arcade) is a pathway-stage with partial work.
100-coin missions have been removed; coins are now a global currency.
development_findings.quote: Yes, 100-coin missions do not exist anymore. Coins are global now.

development_findings.summary: First public demo is in bug-fixing; a second, more limited demo (only Course 1) is planned.
development_findings.quote: There will be a second demo and the second demo will be only Course 1.

development_findings.summary: Night Slide level from earlier showcases will not return, though some materials may be reused.
development_findings.quote: The slide as it was in this kind of a gag will not be returning.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritises player comfort, removing mechanics that could cause frustration (e.g., mandatory purchase of radar).
He dislikes frequent ParaLLEl Launcher updates and prefers Project 64 for convenience, using ParaLLEl only for compatibility checks.
context_findings.quote: You don't need to make an update for every little thing… I will never personally use ParaLLEl Launcher.

context_findings.summary: He intends to buy a second N64 and asked Zeina to pick it up, showing hardware commitment and personal collaboration.
Kaze expresses aversion to 2D games and new programming languages, stating C already does everything he needs.
context_findings.quote: We really don't need more programming languages. C can already do everything we need.

biobak.summary: Working on a line of mushrooms for Course 1 and reviewing the new radar feature.
biobak.quote: There is a line of mushrooms that Biobak is working on that I need to put in.

key_stories.title: Adding the Egg-Coin Radar
key_stories.summary: Kaze replaces purchasable radar with an always-on feature for the new 7th star. He prototypes blinking behavior, color schemes, and transparency while debating potential player confusion and distraction.
key_stories.challenge: Need to guide players to Yoshi coins without making the hunt frustrating or too easy.
key_stories.process: Removed purchase mechanic, coded radar to flash faster near coins, experimented with visual refinements based on chat feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Basic radar system implemented; visual design still under iteration.
key_stories.key_quote: If you haven't bought the radar and you're doing mission 7 with no hint, that's going to be a miserable experience.

key_stories.title: Invisible Lights Bug
key_stories.summary: Dynamic lights in Course 1 refused to appear. After investigation, Kaze discovers a SM64 engine quirk that blocks spawning when bhvParam3 is 255.
key_stories.challenge: Section of level lacked expected crystal lights with no obvious error.
key_stories.process: Checked spawn flags, verified object placement, traced issue to bhvParam3 value.
key_stories.outcome: Lights spawn correctly once parameter changed; serves as cautionary lesson for object params.
key_stories.key_quote: There's a functionality in the engine where if you set the bhv param 3 to 255 the object does not spawn. This is so wild.
